metadata.title: Muhammad Selim
metadata.description: Skilled software engineer with experience in JavaScript, CSS, Tailwind, Node.js, and Express.js. I create dynamic, high-performing web applications. My expertise in the latest technologies ensures that my solutions are cutting-edge. My attention to detail produces visually stunning and technically sound websites.

main.title: Muhammad Selim
main.description: I am a software engineer who specializes in building and designing exceptional digital experiences. Currently, my focus is on creating accessible and human-centered products.

paragraphs: Hello! My name is Muhammad and I am a computer engineering student. My interest in web development started back in 2020 when I decided to learn how web pages are being built — This motivated me to start learning a lot about HTML & CSS!

Fast-forward to today, and I’ve had the privilege of working at [a start-up](https://www.linkedin.com/company/gmind), [a huge corporation](https://www.ibm.com/eg-en), and [student activity](https://www.acm.org/). My main focus these days is building modern, accessible, fast and digital experiences at [Upwork](https://www.upwork.com) for a variety of clients.
I also recently finished the [Professional Front-End Web Development](https://graduation.udacity.com/confirm/DCSMARQZ) program from [Udacity](https://www.udacity.com/) and [egFWD](https://egfwd.com).

places.title: Gmind
description: Developed GMind's Android application for educational purposes using Java and XML
Collaborated with designers and management team to develop and manage company application
Communicate with multi-disciplinary teams of engineers, designers, producers, and clients on a daily basis
Acquired knowledge of Version Control (Git) and Linux commands

places.title: ITI
description: Completed a 60-hour intensive training program in front-end development, focused on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript(ES6)
Practiced skills through the development of small projects including a stopwatch and form validation using pure JavaScript

places.title: IBM eg
description: Developed and maintained code for a landing page using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Tested sites in several browsers and mobile devices to ensure cross-browser compatibility and responsiveness
Added some unit tests using Jest framework

places.title: ACM
description: Held **Game Of Coders 3.0** contest, it is a competitive programming contest, and 26 teams participated in it
Made the plan of the **Team Operations** sub-committee, which is responsible for developing the chapter and evaluating its progress
Spearheaded more than 35 teams from Mansoura to ECPC qualification, 7 teams to ECPC and 2 teams to ACPC
Trained +190 students on competitive programming using C++

featured.title: Personal Website v1
featured.description: First iteration of my personal website built with JavaScript, [GitHub APIs](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/users?apiVersion=2022-11-28), CSS, HTML and hosted on [Cloudflare](https://www.cloudflare.com).

featured.title: Loopstudios
featured.description: A static landing page covers mostly all screen sizes, built using HTML, CSS and Vanilla javascript.

featured.title: Advice Generator App
featured.description: An advice generator app fetches Advice [Slip API](https://api.adviceslip.com) and updates the UI with the new advice generated. It will help if you want to know a random quote.

featured.title: Sunnyside agency
featured.description: A frontend mentor challenge, the Landing page helps marketers achieve various objectives as a result of numerous marketing goals.

featured.title: Intro Section
featured.description: A single-page web page for the introduction section with dropdown navigation and a responsive navigation bar too.

noteworthy_projects.title: GitHub profile
noteworthy_projects.description: A simple look at your GitHub profile and repos. Includes data visualizations of your profile and starred repositories.

noteworthy_projects.title: Mathematical calculator
noteworthy_projects.description: A mathematical calculator built using stack data structure and Postfix expression **Reverse Polish notation**.

noteworthy_projects.title: Next Mangement System
noteworthy_projects.description: An employee management system windows application which is built and released using (C#) .net framework and MS SQL server.

noteworthy_projects.title: Weather App
noteworthy_projects.description: An asynchronous web app that uses Web API and user data to dynamically update the UI for a Weather-Journal App.

noteworthy_projects.title: Udacity Landing Page
noteworthy_projects.description: The first project in FWD professional web program to apply the knowledge of JavaScript and the Document Object Model (DOM) by buliding a multi-section page with a dynamically navigation menu.

noteworthy_projects.title: Microsoft Portfolio
noteworthy_projects.description: A digital resume with a Microsoft windows theme.

noteworthy_projects.title: QR attendance app
noteworthy_projects.description: A QR application can be used to scan, generate, and record QR codes.

noteworthy_projects.title: Order Summary
noteworthy_projects.description: An order summary component shows the deployment of a payment web page.
